kashmiri.text: Giving advice to a stupid man is like giving salt to a squirrel.
Distance lends enchantment.
Don't build the bungalow on an inch of ground.
Economize expenditure.
First for self, then for the stranger.
Good connections should pay.
Good people are gentle.
Good people have set sail to arrive at such gentleness as cuts like diamonds
If you don't have an enemy, don't you have a cousin?
It can be impossible to change an established image.
It does not pay to talk a lot.
Strive to live well within your means.
The bachelors crave to get married, and the married ones regret they got married.
The customers are known to the shopkeeper.
The flea sinned, the reed-mat got the beating.
The income is like jasmine.
The lightest is to be barefooted.
The members of the family are in distress, but the idols are worshipped.
The mother keeps on caring for her daughter while the daughter keeps on craving for her husband.
The sparrow feels comfortable on the thorn bush.
The wiser the man, the more in trouble.
It is not the thunder that causes the rain.
It may be easier to perceive error than to find truth.
It may not pay to weigh everyone in the same scales.
Lice flourish in rags.
May God save me from the one I saved.
Maybe a naked person should not be taken to a cloth shop.
Never scatter pearls for the cocks.
Nine days wonders are forgotten soon after that.
One man cut the bund/barrage, and a thousand people fell into the river.
One man's beard is on fire, and another man warms his hands on it.
When pumpkins are watered, brinjals also get watered.
While alive in rags; when dead in satin to cover the body.
You may adopt an indirect approach to reach your goal.
To chalk out preventive measures in good time before an emergency is much warranted.
To get silk from a stone.
To search for thorns in the milk.
To serve a mean man may not be profitable.
To show one's fist to a blind man is neither a sin nor a virtue.
To smell one's own bosom is fit.
Unity can be equal to a thousand golden coins.
Unwanted meddling in affairs could prove harmful.
Welcome an opportunity as it comes.
Whatever has bloomed, has bloomed from the very bud.
A confused man is like the drowning man who asks for pears from the willow tree.
A human being is quite impatient.
A king for a moment, and a beggar soon after.
A lie doesn't have a foot to stand on.
A truly educated person is a gem.
A very jealous person is glad when somebody else cries, and sighs when others laugh.
After killing a yakur bird your hands will stink.
An idle person may have just three tasks: sleeping, eating and quarrelling.
Anyone can be trapped.
Diamond cuts diamond.
One may be generous at heart, but may not be able to afford it.
One should set sails with the tide.
One should strive to maintain one's honour.
One should try to get enormously benefited by a small effort.
People pretend to dislike what they cannot get.
Prosperity improves one's personality, adversity cripples it.
Prosperity teaches one, and poverty puts one to shame.
Relations last longer when the family is in distress.
Unity is strength.
What care is a friend worth? What handling can a chickling take?
When pumpkins are watered, brinjals also get watered.
When rogues fallout, honest men come by their own.
Wisdom and serenity should not unduly weigh down a person.
The danger past, and God forgotten.
The fall is nobody's sire.
The gardener had not yet dug out the radish, when the beggar held the alms-bowl in front of him.
The hen scratches and the chicken learns.
The sufferer goes through hell till the truth comes out.
To roast fish on sky and to eat them.
To serve a mean person, is to beat the earth.
True religion is in one's heart.
Two's company, the third person is an intruder.
Unity is equal to a thousand golden coins.
A blind man's wife is God's keeping.
A kick works as a treatment to a hunch backed person.
A king for a moment, and a beggar soon after.
A man loves his own shortcomings.
A pestle upon a peg, and a mortar upon a clothes line.
A single log of wood does not burn even in an oven.
Agreement with two people, lamentation with three.
Among the ignorant a little knowledge is of great value.
Bad times came to be; hens on thrones we were to see.
Bolted windows with the door ajar.
If it comes, it is golden; if it doesn't, it was made of grass.
Ignorance is the peace of life.
It doesn't take time to change one's destiny.
Its tuff to find fools; ten in every other house.
Life cannot be trusted; death can come at any moment.
No strength within, no respect without.
No sunshine but hath some shadow.
No sweet without sweat.
O daughter, I'm telling you. O daughter-in-law, listen to it.
Obeisance to the self that is a reflection of eternal reality.
Clean your heart and mind of negative thoughts.
Destiny often withholds the crown from the very person who deserves it.
Don't count your chicken before they hatch.
Eleven persons take eleven paths.
Empty vessels make much noise.
Food will last while the forests last.
Forcing a bludgeon through a chinar trunk. Doing the impossible.
Giving advice to a stupid man is like giving salt to a squirrel.
God is the friend of both the simple guy and the leper.
I bought the nettle, sowed the nettle, and then the nettle stung me.
One and one are sometimes eleven.
One man can burn water, whereas another cannot even burn oil.
One man cut the barrage, and a thousand people fell into the river.
One man's beard is on fire, and another man warms his hands on it.
One man's breath's another man's death.
One plus one makes eleven.
Saving mustard seeds in hand, while a watermelon escapes.
Service is greatness.
The bachelors crave it, and the married ones regret it.
The customers are known to the shopkeepers.
Rice tastes good when properly cooked, and talking is good when the opportunity is ripe.
She wants to have buttermilk, but has hidden the pot brought for it behind one's back.
Saving the mustard seeds in your hand might cause you to miss out on getting a watermelon.
The healthy person experiences a healthy world.
The message spoken to the daughter is often aimed at the daughter-in-law.
Saving mustard seeds in hand, while a watermelon escapes.
The Gardner had not yet dug out the radish, when the beggar held the alms-bowl in front of him.
Eleven persons take eleven paths.
Ignorance is the peace of life.
O daughter, I’m telling you. O daughter-in-law, listen to it.
The customers are known to the shopkeepers.
One man cut the barrage, and a thousand people fell into the river.
